text: hi everyone my Autumn Festival Tecton
Poe is coming in a few weeks and many of
you have requested for a mooncake
tutorial so today I will make snow skin
mooncake or bunny yellow my autumn
festival is held on the full moon day of
the eighth month in lunar calendar in
Vietnam is considered one of the most
important holiday tradition especially
for the children I love seeing the
excitement and happiness on their
smiling faces when participating in
parades with London's called
root been watching lion dances and
eating moon cakes this is also a special
occasion for Thanksgiving in Vietnam and
moon cakes are of course the more common
presents that are given to show
gratitude and because my parents were
teachers my house were always full of
moon cakes on this occasion and you know
when you have too much of something you
will be sick of it
so I didn't really like moon cakes when
I was a kid but when I moved to live
abroad during this time of the year
I really missed the come from bits of
the lion dances now what you're hearing
right now the lantern parades and
believe it or not the moon cakes so I
will try my kids today let's begin
we can I firstly make a simple syrup in
a saucepan combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup
water bring to a boil and occasionally
swirl the saucepan to have the sugar
dissolves do not stir
especially when the bubbles start coming
up lower the heat and simmer for 2 to 3
minutes until the sugar is completely
dissolved then add a tablespoon of lime
juice to prevent the sugar from
recrystallizing and let cool to room
temperature it would be better if you
can make this one day before but it's
still ok to use right after it has
cooled down to make the fillings rings
and soak the mung beans in water for one
hour and then cook in a rice cooker
until soft then combine with sugar
vegetable oil salt and vanilla and pull
to process in a food processor into a
fine paste if you want to keep the cake
for more than 2 days you need to cook
the mung bean paste in a non-stick pan
with vegetable oil and a tablespoon of
cooked glutinous rice flour keep
stirring and mixing until it all comes
together and become smooth it would
takes about 15 minutes or more the
longer you do this step the longer you
can keep the cakes try to stop before
it's getting to cry because we want the
fillings to be soft and smooth then
divide and shape into balls for the doll
you will need cooked glutinous rice
flour it is so an Asian store in a
package like this make sure you use the
right flour for this recipe because it
wouldn't work with other Kai's in a
mixing bowl combine the same amount of
the flour and the simple syrup let's say
you make half a cup each then add about
1/8 TSP of the pomelo aroma extract it
will give the cake is distinct aroma
then mix with a spatula until well
combined
again you need to use the cooked
glutinous rice flour and not the normal
type because it's edible like this and
we're not gonna cook it under any forms
sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the same flour
onto the
King sofas also dust your hand with the
flour to avoid sticking when it all
comes together scrape it off the bowl
and transfer to the floured working
surface knead the dough by folding
method until it's no longer sticks to
your hands
this is the mooncake moles that I'm
using basically you want the hollow part
facing inwards maybe you can find it at
your local Asian store if not you can
find many other similar kites on eBay or
Amazon
that's your mooncake moles with the same
flower put a piece of the snow skin into
the mold and press down firmly place a
ball filling in the center cover with
another piece of snow skin sprinkle some
more flour on top to avoid sticking use
a piece of aluminum foil to press down
firmly and do this form a flat surface
on the edges of that moon cake mode
remove the mud cake from the mall and
look how beautiful that is
how much fillings and how much snow skin
to put in each mud cake
it depends on the size of the mold and
also your personal preference normally
it will be 40% for the snow skin and 60%
for the fillings I've just did the same
with the rail mode and look at this it's
so pretty the snow skin is soft
gluttonous and sweet it has a pleasant
smell of the Palmetto flower
it's so perfect to go with a cup of hot
green tea sometimes people add a salted
egg yolk inside and but I'm not a fan of
it so I just skip it I hope you gonna
enjoy making this food cake as much and
add it thank you for watching
